units.title: Generation of CAG::Cas9 hiPS cell line
units.text: The CAG::Cas9 line was generated as previously described53. (2 × 10^6 cells) dissociated with accutase (Innovative Cell Technology) were electroporated using the P3 Primary Cell 4D-NucleofectorTMX Kit L (Lonza, catalogue no. V4XP-3024), a 4D-nucleofector core unit and X unit (Lonza; nucleofection program no. CA-137). Once the seeded cells reached 70–80% confluency, 1 µg ml−1 puromycin in StemFlex medium (Life Technologies, catalogue no. A3349401) was supplemented for 5 days. Colonies were visible at the end of 5 days of selection in puromycin. Cells were maintained in StemFlex medium for another 5 days, and individual colonies were picked.
units.rationale: Describes the stepwise creation and selection of the engineered hiPS cell line.

units.title: Passaging hiPS cell colonies
units.text: To passage hiPS cell colonies, cells were incubated with 0.5 mM EDTA for 7 min at room temperature, resuspended in Essential 8 medium and distributed into new six-well plates.
units.rationale: Provides a concise protocol for subculturing hiPS cell colonies.

units.title: Design and cloning of sgRNA library
units.text: The interneuron migration CRISPR sgRNA library was designed by selecting up to five sgRNAs targeting each of the 438 genes of interest (425 NDD genes and 13 genes associated with interneuron development) and an extra 10% ‘safe‑harbour‑targeting’ negative control sgRNAs (Supplementary Table 2). Cloning restriction sites and amplification primer handles were appended to each oligo. The sgRNA library oligos were synthesized on the Agilent chip oligo array synthesis platform and cloned into a lentiviral plasmid vector that constitutively expresses the sgRNA and mCherry.
units.rationale: Outlines the creation of a pooled sgRNA library for the screen.

units.title: Generation of 3D human cortical organoids (hCO)
units.text: To generate 3D hCO, hiPS cells were dissociated with accutase to obtain a single‑cell suspension. About 3 × 10^6 cells were seeded per AggreWell 800 plate well in Essential 8 medium supplemented with the ROCK inhibitor Y27632 (10 µM). The plate was centrifuged at 100 g for 3 min and incubated overnight at 37 °C, 5% CO2. The next day (day 0), cellular aggregates were transferred into ultra‑low attachment plastic dishes (Corning, catalogue no. 3262) and cultured in E6 medium (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. A1516401) supplemented with dorsomorphin (2.5 µM), SB‑431542 (10 µM) and XAV‑939 (1.25 µM).
units.rationale: Details the steps to differentiate hiPS cells into cortical organoids.

units.title: Lentivirus production
units.text: Lentivirus was produced by transfecting human embryonic kidney 293T cells with lentiviral transfer plasmids, packaging plasmids and by Synthego (see Supplementary Table 6 for the sgRNA sequences) to induce one or more fragment deletions (Extended Data Fig. 4b).
units.rationale: Summarizes the production of lentiviral particles for gene delivery.

units.title: Real‑time quantitative PCR
units.text: For real‑time qPCR analysis, 2–3 organoids were pooled as a sample. mRNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Plus kit (Qiagen, catalogue no. 74136) and template complementary DNA was prepared by reverse transcription using the SuperScript III First‑Strand Synthesis SuperMix. Real‑time qPCR was performed using the SYBR Green PCR Master Mix (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. 4312704) on a QuantStudio 6 Flex Real‑Time PCR System (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. 4366076).
units.rationale: Provides the workflow for quantifying gene expression by qPCR.

units.title: Generation of SMAD4 HET hiPS cells
units.text: To generate SMAD4 HET lines in the 1205‑4 genetic background, 0.5 million cells were mixed with 40 pmol of sgRNA (AAAAAGAGCAAUUGAAAGUU) and 5 µg of Cas9 protein (Alt‑R S.p. Cas9 Nuclease V3). The mixture was incubated at 37 °C for roughly 18 h. After washing with PBS (2 h × 3, 37 °C), samples were incubated in a nuclear staining solution (1:150 dilution of RedDot Biotium 40061‑T) in PBS with 500 mM NaCl at 37 °C overnight.
units.rationale: Describes the genome‑editing and staining steps to create heterozygous SMAD4 hiPS cells.

units.title: Dissociation of hCO and hSO
units.text: hCO and hSO were dissociated as previously described57 with some modifications. Briefly, organoids were incubated with an enzyme solution containing 10 U ml−1 papain (Worthington, catalogue no. LS003127), 0.36% d(+)-glucose, 26 mM NaHCO3, 0.5 mM EDTA, 1× Earle’s balanced salt solution, 0.2% trypsin inhibitor (Worthington, catalogue no. LS003086) for 15 min at 37 °C with 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Provides a protocol for enzymatic dissociation of organoids into single cells.

units.title: Live‑cell imaging of Dlxi1/2b::eGFP+ cell migration
units.text: To image the Dlxi1/2b::eGFP+ cell migration, hFA were transferred to a well of a 96‑well plate with a clear bottom (ibidi, catalogue no. 89626) in 500 µl of neural medium under environmentally controlled conditions (37 °C, 5% CO2). Samples were placed in this condition for 30–60 min, then imaged under a ×10 objective at a depth of 50–150 µm at a rate of roughly 20 min per frame for 18–22 h.
units.rationale: Outlines the setup for time‑lapse imaging of migrating neurons.
